name: Krond the Dawn-Clad
text:
Flying, vigilance
Whenever Krond the Dawn-Clad attacks, if it's enchanted, exile target permanent.

editions.flavor: Krond, the personification of the dawn's light, lives to exact justice on his nemesis Vela.
Krond, the personification of the dawn's light, lives to exact justice on his nemesis Vela.

name: Krosa
text:
All creatures get +2/+2.
Whenever you roll {CHAOS}, you may add {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} to your mana pool.

name: Krosan Archer
text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
{G}, Discard a card: Krosan Archer gets +0/+2 until end of turn.

name: Krosan Avenger
text:
Trample
Threshold — {1}{G}: Regenerate Krosan Avenger. Activate this ability only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

editions.flavor: She'd have a fearsome reputation if she left any survivors.

name: Krosan Beast
text: Threshold — Krosan Beast gets +7/+7 as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

editions.flavor: Those who see the squirrels go underground in the winter aren't ready for what emerges in the spring.

name: Krosan Cloudscraper
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Krosan Cloudscraper unless you pay {G}{G}.
Morph {7}{G}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

name: Krosan Colossus
text: Morph {6}{G}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

editions.flavor: When it walked, it altered geography. When it bellowed, it changed the weather.

name: Krosan Constrictor
text:
Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
{T}: Target black creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"It's a slithering, coldblooded menace. I've gotta respect that."
—Braids, dementia summoner

name: Krosan Drover
text: Creature spells you cast with converted mana cost 6 or greater cost {2} less to cast.

editions.flavor: "Sit."

name: Krosan Grip
text:
Split second (As long as this spell is on the stack, players can't cast spells or activate abilities that aren't mana abilities.)
Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

editions.flavor:
"Give up these unnatural weapons, these scrolls. Heart and mind and fist are enough."
—Zyd, Kamahlite druid

"Give up these unnatural weapons, these scrolls. Heart and mind and fist are enough."
—Zyd, Kamahlite druid

"Give up these unnatural weapons, these scrolls. Heart and mind and fist are enough."
—Zyd, Kamahlite druid

"Give up these unnatural weapons, these scrolls. Heart and mind and fist are enough."
—Zyd, Kamahlite druid

name: Krosan Groundshaker
text: {G}: Target Beast creature gains trample until end of turn.

editions.flavor: You know it's coming when you hear the distant thunder. You know where it's been when you see the path of broken trees.

name: Krosan Reclamation
text:
Target player shuffles up to two target cards from his or her graveyard into his or her library.
Flashback {1}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Krosan Restorer
text:
{T}: Untap target land.
Threshold — {T}: Untap up to three target lands. Activate this ability only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

name: Krosan Tusker
text:
Cycling {2}{G} ({2}{G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Krosan Tusker, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Garruk vs. Liliana

name: Krosan Verge
text:
Krosan Verge enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{2}, {T}, Sacrifice Krosan Verge: Search your library for a Forest card and a Plains card and put them onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

name: Krosan Vorine
text:
Provoke (Whenever this creature attacks, you may have target creature defending player controls untap and block it if able.)
Krosan Vorine can't be blocked by more than one creature.

name: Krosan Warchief
text:
Beast spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
{1}{G}: Regenerate target Beast.

editions.flavor: It turns prey into predator.
It turns prey into predator.
It turns prey into predator.

name: Krosan Wayfarer
text: Sacrifice Krosan Wayfarer: You may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield.

editions.flavor:
"The Krosan Forest lives, and druids are its seeds."
—Seton, centaur druid

name: Krovikan Elementalist
text:
{2}{R}: Target creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{U}{U}: Target creature you control gains flying until end of turn. Sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.

editions.flavor:
"The Elementalists' talents could be useful if turned to other purposes."
—Zur the Enchanter

name: Krovikan Fetish
text:
Enchant creature
When Krovikan Fetish enters the battlefield, draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.

editions.flavor: Some Krovikans find strength in the ears and eyes of their victims and wear such fetishes into battle.
Some Krovikans find strength in the ears and eyes of their victims and wear such fetishes into battle.
Some Krovikans find strength in the ears and eyes of their victims and wear such fetishes into battle.

name: Krovikan Horror
text:
At the beginning of the end step, if Krovikan Horror is in your graveyard with a creature card directly above it, you may return Krovikan Horror to your hand.
{1}, Sacrifice a creature: Krovikan Horror deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

name: Krovikan Mist
text:
Flying
Krovikan Mist's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Illusions on the battlefield.

editions.flavor:
"It's as strong as you believe it is, and it's very convincing."
—Jace Beleren
Plague-induced dreams became real as they swirled above Krov, mingling with the magical residue of the World Spell.

name: Krovikan Plague
text:
Enchant non-Wall creature you control
When Krovikan Plague enters the battlefield, draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
Tap enchanted creature: Krovikan Plague deals 1 damage to target creature or player. Put a -0/-1 counter on enchanted creature. Activate this ability only if enchanted creature is untapped.

name: Krovikan Rot
text:
Destroy target creature with power 2 or less.
Recover {1}{B}{B} (When a creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may pay {1}{B}{B}. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, exile this card.)

editions.flavor: The few surviving humans of Krov would have welcomed the return of winter and its sterilizing cold. They often peered northward, hoping that the snow's edge had reached their infested city-tomb.

name: Krovikan Sorcerer
text:
{T}, Discard a nonblack card: Draw a card.
{T}, Discard a black card: Draw two cards, then discard one of them.

editions.flavor:
"These sorcerers always seem to have another surprise up their sleeves."
—Zur the Enchanter

"These sorcerers always seem to have another surprise up their sleeves."
—Zur the Enchanter

"These Sorcerers always seem to have another surprise up their sleeves."
—Zur the Enchanter

name: Krovikan Vampire
text: At the beginning of each end step, if a creature dealt damage by Krovikan Vampire this turn died, put that card onto the battlefield under your control. Sacrifice it when you lose control of Krovikan Vampire.

name: Krovikan Whispers
text:
Enchant creature
Cumulative upkeep {U} or {B} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
You control enchanted creature.
When Krovikan Whispers is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you lose 2 life for each age counter on it.

name: Kruin Outlaw
text:
First strike
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Kruin Outlaw.

editions.flavor: "Hold tight. I've got a surprise for them."

name: Kruin Striker
text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, Kruin Striker gets +1/+0 and gains trample until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Unhappy with the creation of the wolfir, Rorica broke with her order and led a crusade against the "reformed werewolves."

name: Krumar Bond-Kin
text: Morph {4}{B} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

editions.flavor: "The Abzan replaced my savagery with a noble heritage. I would give my life for my House."

name: Kruphix, God of Horizons
text:
Indestructible
As long as your devotion to green and blue is less than seven, Kruphix isn't a creature.
You have no maximum hand size.
If unused mana would empty from your mana pool, that mana becomes colorless instead.

name: Kruphix's Insight
text: Reveal the top six cards of your library. Put up to three enchantment cards from among them into your hand and the rest of the revealed cards into your graveyard.

editions.flavor: The horizon is tantalizing in both its uncertainty and its potential.

name: Kry Shield
text: {2}, {T}: Prevent all damage that would be dealt this turn by target creature you control. That creature gets +0/+X until end of turn, where X is its converted mana cost.

name: Kudzu
text:
Enchant land
When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it. That land's controller attaches Kudzu to a land of his or her choice.

name: Kujar Seedsculptor
text: When Kujar Seedsculptor enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control.

editions.flavor: Every leaf, tree, and building in Kujar has been placed to achieve maximum harmony, in accordance with the elvish philosophy known as the Great Conduit.

name: Kukemssa Pirates
text: Whenever Kukemssa Pirates attacks and isn't blocked, you may gain control of target artifact defending player controls. If you do, Kukemssa Pirates assigns no combat damage this turn.

editions.flavor:
". . . pirates gambled with a djinn and lost the thing more dear than gold."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Kukemssa Serpent
text:
Kukemssa Serpent can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
{U}, Sacrifice an Island: Target land an opponent controls becomes an Island until end of turn.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Kukemssa Serpent.

name: Kuldotha Flamefiend
text: When Kuldotha Flamefiend enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice an artifact. If you do, Kuldotha Flamefiend deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.

name: Kuldotha Forgemaster
text: {T}, Sacrifice three artifacts: Search your library for an artifact card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: The goblins say it used to be larger, before it began to stoke the Great Furnace with pieces of itself.

name: Kuldotha Phoenix
text:
Flying, haste
Metalcraft — {4}: Return Kuldotha Phoenix from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only if you control three or more artifacts.

name: Kuldotha Rebirth
text:
As an additional cost to cast Kuldotha Rebirth, sacrifice an artifact.
Create three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.

editions.flavor: All goblin rituals serve a dual purpose as fertility rites, even the destructive ones. Especially the destructive ones.

name: Kuldotha Ringleader
text:
Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
Kuldotha Ringleader attacks each turn if able.

editions.flavor: Being surrounded by goblins is less objectionable when they're fighting for you.

name: Kulrath Knight
text:
Flying
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
Creatures your opponents control with counters on them can't attack or block.

editions.flavor: Mounted cinders circle the blasted peak at Kulrath, hunting the Extinguisher.

name: Kumano, Master Yamabushi
text:
{1}{R}: Kumano, Master Yamabushi deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
If a creature dealt damage by Kumano this turn would die, exile it instead.

name: Kumano's Blessing
text:
Flash
Enchant creature
If a creature dealt damage by enchanted creature this turn would die, exile it instead.

name: Kumano's Pupils
text: If a creature dealt damage by Kumano's Pupils this turn would die, exile it instead.

editions.flavor:
"Long before he reluctantly joined the war, stories spread of Kumano's followers winning victories against the kami."
—Observations of the Kami War

name: Kuon, Ogre Ascendant
text: At the beginning of the end step, if three or more creatures died this turn, flip Kuon, Ogre Ascendant.

name: Kuon's Essence
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a creature.

name: Kurgadon
text: Whenever you cast a creature spell with converted mana cost 6 or greater, put three +1/+1 counters on Kurgadon.

editions.flavor: When it walks through Krosa, trees step aside, leaves take wing, and the ground shudders.

name: Kurkesh, Onakke Ancient
text: Whenever you activate an ability of an artifact, if it isn't a mana ability, you may pay {R}. If you do, copy that ability. You may choose new targets for the copy.

editions.flavor: The Onakke were masters of dark arts and artifice. Their creations continue to spread foul magic, paving the way for their return.

name: Kuro, Pitlord
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Kuro, Pitlord unless you pay {B}{B}{B}{B}.
Pay 1 life: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Divine vs. Demonic

name: Kuro's Taken
text:
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{1}{B}: Regenerate Kuro's Taken.

editions.flavor: Simple bargains are the most tempting, and oni bargains are the simplest of all: eternal life for eternal service.

name: Kusari-Gama
text:
Equipped creature has "{2}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn."
Whenever equipped creature deals damage to a blocking creature, Kusari-Gama deals that much damage to each other creature defending player controls.
Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

name: Kydele, Chosen of Kruphix
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool for each card you've drawn this turn.
Partner (You can have two commanders if both have partner.)

editions.flavor: She bears the greatest burden of all: that of knowing.

name: Kynaios and Tiro of Meletis
text: At the beginning of your end step, draw a card. Each player may put a land card from his or her hand onto the battlefield, then each opponent who didn't draws a card.

editions.flavor: "Look what we fought for. Look what we built together."

name: Kyoki, Sanity's Eclipse
text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, target opponent exiles a card from his or her hand.

editions.flavor:
"Kyoki, Eater of Minds, Corrupter of Thoughts, Bringer of Madness, Lord of Fear. Return, by our blood, and walk again."
—Ogre chant

name: Kyren Archive
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may exile the top card of your library face down.
{5}, Discard your hand, Sacrifice Kyren Archive: Put all cards exiled with Kyren Archive into their owner's hand.

name: Kyren Glider
text:
Flying
Kyren Glider can't block.

editions.flavor: Mercadia's Kyren goblins are the opposite of Dominarian goblins: they're smart and cowardly.

name: Kyren Legate
text:
Haste
If an opponent controls a Plains and you control a Mountain, you may cast Kyren Legate without paying its mana cost.

name: Kyren Negotiations
text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Kyren Negotiations deals 1 damage to target player.

editions.flavor: Kyren goblins always speak in questions and never allow wrong answers.

name: Kyren Sniper
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may have Kyren Sniper deal 1 damage to target player.

editions.flavor: Kyren goblins always act behind the scenes—even in battle.

name: Kyren Toy
text:
{1}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Kyren Toy.
{T}, Remove X charge counters from Kyren Toy: Add an amount of {C} to your mana pool equal to X plus one.

name: Kyscu Drake
text:
Flying
{G}: Kyscu Drake gets +0/+1 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
Sacrifice Kyscu Drake and a creature named Spitting Drake: Search your library for a card named Viashivan Dragon and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

name: Kytheon, Hero of Akros
text:
At end of combat, if Kytheon, Hero of Akros and at least two other creatures attacked this combat, exile Kytheon, then return him to the battlefield transformed under his owner's control.
{2}{W}: Kytheon gains indestructible until end of turn.

name: Kytheon's Irregulars
text:
Renown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)
{W}{W}: Tap target creature.

editions.flavor: Kytheon and his irregulars worked outside the law to bring justice to the streets of Akros.
Kytheon and his irregulars worked outside the law to bring justice to the streets of Akros.

name: Kytheon's Tactics
text:
Creatures you control get +2/+1 until end of turn.
Spell mastery — If there are two or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard, those creatures also gain vigilance until end of turn. (Attacking doesn't cause them to tap.)

editions.flavor: "Seal the gate. This is our fight now."

name: Laboratory Brute
text: When Laboratory Brute enters the battlefield, put the top four cards of your library into your graveyard.

editions.flavor: It keeps intruders out and experiments in.

name: Laboratory Maniac
text: If you would draw a card while your library has no cards in it, you win the game instead.

editions.flavor: His mind whirled with grand plans, never thinking of what might happen if he were to succeed.

name: Lab Rats
text:
Buyback {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Create a 1/1 black Rat creature token.

name: Labyrinth Champion
text: Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Labyrinth Champion, Labyrinth Champion deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: "It used to be a lair. Now it's just a tunnel."

name: Labyrinth Minotaur
text: Whenever Labyrinth Minotaur blocks a creature, that creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

editions.flavor:
"Legend says they got a treasure cave, but it don't say where to find it."
—Zeki, Reef Pirate

"I doubt any Labyrinth Minotaurs still live—but then again, we Minotaurs are stubborn beings."
—Onatah, Anaba Shaman

"I doubt any labyrinth minotaurs still live—but then again, we minotaurs are stubborn beings."
—Onatah, Anaba Shaman

"I doubt any labyrinth minotaurs still live—but then we minotaurs are stubborn beings."
—Onatah, Anaba shaman

name: Laccolith Grunt
text: Whenever Laccolith Grunt becomes blocked, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature. If you do, Laccolith Grunt assigns no combat damage this turn.

editions.flavor: They leave a trail of ash and sorrow.

name: Laccolith Rig
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature becomes blocked, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature. If you do, the first creature assigns no combat damage this turn.

name: Laccolith Titan
text: Whenever Laccolith Titan becomes blocked, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature. If you do, Laccolith Titan assigns no combat damage this turn.

editions.flavor: Proximity guarantees injury or death.

name: Laccolith Warrior
text: Whenever Laccolith Warrior becomes blocked, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature. If you do, Laccolith Warrior assigns no combat damage this turn.

editions.flavor: The screams are brief. The silence lingers.

name: Laccolith Whelp
text: Whenever Laccolith Whelp becomes blocked, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature. If you do, Laccolith Whelp assigns no combat damage this turn.

editions.flavor: They don't feed; they stoke.

name: Lace with Moonglove
text:
Target creature gains deathtouch until end of turn. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy that creature.)
Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"Which is more filled with poison: the flower of the moonglove or the minds of elves?"
—Vessifrus, flamekin demagogue

"Which is more filled with poison: the flower of the moonglove or the minds of elves?"
—Vessifrus, flamekin demagogue

name: Ladies' Knight
text:
Flying
Spells that players wearing at least one item of women's clothing play cost {1} less to play. (Women's clothing is designed to be worn exclusively by women.)

editions.flavor:
"I said ‘Put him in a core set, not a corset'"
—Richard Garfield, Ph.D.

name: Lady Caleria
text: {T}: Lady Caleria deals 3 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

name: Lady Evangela
text: {W}{B}, {T}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target creature this turn.

editions.flavor:
"When milady was young, the sight of a rainbow would fill her soul with peace. As she grew, she learned to share her rapture with others."
—Lady Gabriella
"When milady was young, the sight of a rainbow would fill her soul with peace. As she grew, she learned to share her rapture with others." —Lady Gabriella

"I do not remember what he said to her. I remember her fiery eyes, fixed upon him for an instant. I remember a flash, and the hot breath of sudden flames made me turn away. When I looked again, Angus was gone."
—A Wayfarer, on meeting Lady Orca

"I do not remember what he said to her. I remember her fiery eyes, fixed upon him for an instant. I remember a flash, and the hot breath of sudden flames made me turn away. When I looked again, Angus was gone." —A Wayfarer, on meeting Lady Orca

"I do not remember what he said to her. I remember her fiery eyes, fixed upon him for an instant. I remember a flash, and the hot breath of sudden flames made me turn away. When I looked again, Angus was gone." —A Wayfarer, on meeting Lady Orca

name: Lady Sun
text: {T}: Return Lady Sun and another target creature to their owners' hands. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

editions.flavor: Sister to Sun Quan and wife to Liu Bei, Lady Sun often felt her loyalty to both tested.

name: Lady Zhurong, Warrior Queen
text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

editions.flavor:
"A man, and such a fool! I, a woman, will fight them for you."
—Lady Zhurong to her husband Meng Huo, before leading an army against the Shu

Tracing their ancestry back to Zendikar's earliest forms of life, lagac lizards have seen the comings and goings of planeswalkers and the Eldrazi, and the rise of the vampire clans, none of which has changed them one bit.

name: Lagonna-Band Elder
text: When Lagonna-Band Elder enters the battlefield, if you control an enchantment, you gain 3 life.

editions.flavor: "The best lessons are not the ones I teach. They are the ones the pupils realize for themselves."

name: Lagonna-Band Trailblazer
text: Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Lagonna-Band Trailblazer, put a +1/+1 counter on Lagonna-Band Trailblazer.

editions.flavor: Go forth with honor, return with glory.

name: Lair Delve
text: Reveal the top two cards of your library. Put all creature and land cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

editions.flavor: "The fiends have fled. Well, good riddance. Nothing I like more than an empty lair."

name: Lair of the Ashen Idol
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature. If you can't, planeswalk.
Whenever you roll {CHAOS}, any number of target players each create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.

name: Lairwatch Giant
text:
Lairwatch Giant can block an additional creature each combat.
Whenever Lairwatch Giant blocks two or more creatures, it gains first strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor: A giant can brood over a grudge for decades, and woe to those who interrupt him.

name: Lake of the Dead
text:
If Lake of the Dead would enter the battlefield, sacrifice a Swamp instead. If you do, put Lake of the Dead onto the battlefield. If you don't, put it into its owner's graveyard.
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice a Swamp: Add {B}{B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.

name: Lambholt Butcher
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Lambholt Butcher.

editions.flavor: True peace can't be achieved until everyone else is dead.

name: Lambholt Elder
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Lambholt Elder.

editions.flavor:
"Be wary of the seemingly gentle souls. The weak here were slaughtered long ago."
—Rem Karolus, Blade of the Inquisitors

name: Lambholt Pacifist
text:
Lambholt Pacifist can't attack unless you control a creature with power 4 or greater.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Lambholt Pacifist.

name: Lammastide Weave
text:
Name a card, then target player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard. If that card is the named card, you gain life equal to its converted mana cost.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: "A ribbon torn will ward away dark dreams."

name: Lamplighter of Selhoff
text: When Lamplighter of Selhoff enters the battlefield, if you control another Zombie, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card.

editions.flavor: For stitchers and necro-alchemists, it's important that work can continue at all hours.

name: Lance
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has first strike.

name: Lancers en-Kor
text:
Trample
{0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Lancers en-Kor this turn is dealt to target creature you control instead.

editions.flavor: Nearly all sets of Kor twins are trained as lancers.

name: Land Aid '04
text: Search your library for a basic land card, put that card into play tapped, then shuffle your library. If you sang a song the whole time you were searching and shuffling, you may untap that land.

name: Landbind Ritual
text: You gain 2 life for each Plains you control.

editions.flavor:
"Honor this place, for our children's children will stand here and speak these same words again."
—Ayli, Kamsa cleric
